results.title: Born to be small
results.creator_credit: Derek Hart, Tony Snowdon and Associated Television
results.brief_description: Looks at what it is like to be a “little person”, stressing that it is in physical size only that such people differ from others.

results.title: Boomtown
results.brief_description: An animation in which satirist Jules Feiffer makes a pungent comment on the US arms race and military build-up. Text by Jules Feiffer, animation by Bill Plympton.

results.title: Boiler house practice
results.creator_credit: George Wynn and C W S Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film was made to encourage economy in the use of fuel through efficient boiler house practice. Points mentioned include: correct tools, methods of hand-firing, control of air-flow, care of mechanical stokers, regular cleaning of heating surfaces, the necessity for careful maintenance generally. Particular emphasis is placed on the part of the fireman.

results.title: Bobwhite: through the year
results.creator_credit: Charles W. Schwartz and Missouri Conservation Commission
results.brief_description: Shows the quail’s dependence upon man’s use of the land, and the role of food, cover, weather, predation, and all other ecological factors have on the survival of the Bobwhite quail. Begins with the spring nesting season and follows the birds through summer, autumn, winter and back to spring. Beautifully photographed and great close-up shots of the quail as well as various other insects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles W. Schwartz and Missouri Conservation Commission

results.title: Bluestone
results.brief_description: The prospect of demolition and destruction of several historic bluestone buildings dating back to the 1850s was eventually avoided through public opinion and a resulting classification by the Housing Heritage Trust. This documentary is of great historical value.
results.description: The prospect of demolition and destruction of several historic bluestone buildings dating back to the 1850s was eventually avoided through public opinion and a resulting classification by the Housing Heritage Trust. This documentary is of great historical value.

results.title: Bluegrass country
results.brief_description: A film of the annual Bluegrass Music Festival at Berryville, Virginia. Conveys the history of this indigenous American folk-music through the high-energy performances of the professional musicans and impromtu jam sessions of their fans. The performers discuss their music. No other credits available.

results.title: Examination of a Patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
The procedure for a full head to toe examination of a patient. Utilising a common accident scene the program shows the steps required in handling an unconscious patient before medical help arrives.
results.description:

results.title: Basic Life Support
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Highlights the importance of a commonsense approach to emergency situations. After covering the life threatening priorities of airway, breathing and circulation, the program goes on to explain in detail history (what happened), signs (what you see or feel) and symptoms (what the patient feels). An accident scene highlights this approach and stresses the need for urgent action.
